Impact on Humans: Massive geomagnetic storm; disrupted telegraphs and caused auroras visible worldwide.
Meteor airburst over Siberia; flattened forests over a large area, no known human casualties.
Comet collision with Jupiter; provided insights into impact risks on Earth.
Geomagnetic storm; caused power grid failure in Quebec, and auroras as far south as Texas.
Meteor explosion over Russia; caused injuries to over 1,500 people, highlighting meteor threats.
Asteroid impact; believed to have caused the extinction of the dinosaurs and massive environmental changes.
Near-miss solar storm; could have caused widespread power outages and technological disruptions on Earth.
Panic due to the comet's close approach; fears of toxic gases in the comet's tail.
Spectacular meteor storm; caused widespread fear and wonder, influencing cultural perceptions of meteors.
Discovery of impact crater; confirmed as the site of the asteroid that caused the mass extinction event 66 million years ago.
